result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina A Dohearty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Eagle Police Department. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform any treating physician of this case and your history.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain full time employment and/or school. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 06/19/14 by 5pm. Transfer allowed to Jefferson County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina A Dohearty

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christina A Dohearty in court with Attorney Anthony C Kraujalis.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in. State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kraujalis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS     **transfer allowed to Jefferson County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform any treating physician of this case and history
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____6 Months Driver's License Revocation

BUY MONEY:  $800.00- payable to Eagle Police Department (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence by 5:00 p.m. on 6/19/14 - transfer allowed to Jefferson County

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Christina A Dohearty in court with Attorney Anthony C Kraujalis.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kraujalis requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christina A Dohearty in court with attorney Anthony C Kraujalis.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.

  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program. Comply with all juvenile court orders.

Defendant Christina A Dohearty in court with attorney Anthony C. Kraujalis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.   Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
